description: black lacquered box with stylized thatched-roof house with peaked gray roof and low eaves; gold fence at R; gold tree at L with round mother-of-pearl blossoms
medium: Gold, lead, maki-e lacquer, and mother-of-pearl on wood
text: Delicate mother-of-pearl and lead sheet inlays are deftly used in this small box designed by Kamisaka Sekka. Over the smooth surface of the black lacquered background (roiro) and matte sprinkled gold (fundame) base of the tree and house exterior, the inlays are markedly raised. This effect, which adds a level of depth to the overall composition, would have been achieved by molding the lead and pearl inlays over a layer of sabi urushi. Sabi urushi is composed of a paste of lacquer, pumice and water, that allows the artist to quickly mold and build-up layers for this and other decorative techniques such as takamaki-e (high-relief sprinkled powder).
title: Small Box with Country House
